question: Which of the following pairs of sentences highlights the difference between future perfect and future perfect continuous?
options:
"By next week, we will have launched the product."
"By next week, we will be launching the product."

"By 10 p.m., they will have left the office."
"By 10 p.m., they will have been leaving the office."

"She will have read the book by tonight."
"She will read the book by tonight."

"I will have been working on this project."
"I will work on this project."

options:
"By tomorrow evening, they will have rehearsed the play five times."
"By tomorrow evening, they will have been rehearsing the play for five hours."

"By midnight, the team will have wrapped up the meeting."
"By midnight, the team will be wrapping up the meeting."

"I will have been living in Paris for two years by the time I move."
"I will have moved to Paris two years ago."

"By next week, we will have been booking the venue."
